category: Marketing Regulations/Article 13 (Matters to be complied with by competition/event participants, commercial rights holders, etc.)
contents: Article 13 (Matters to be observed by competition/event participants, commercial rights holders, etc.) ① Competition/event participants must wear the official clothing and equipment of the sports conference when participating in competitions or events. If there is a special reason why you cannot wear the official clothes and equipment of the Sports Council, you must submit a written explanation to the Sports Council for prior approval and follow the results of the Sports Council's approval. ② Commercial rights holders may use the portraits, names, images, etc. of participants in competitions and events related to Article 12, Paragraph 1 of these regulations with prior approval from the Sports Council. ③ If a person other than a participant in a competition or event or a person with a commercial right wishes to use the portrait, name, image, etc. related to Article 12 (1) of these regulations for commercial purposes in Korea during a competition or event separately determined by the Sports Council, prior approval of the Sports Council must be obtained. It must be received and must comply with related regulations such as the IOC Charter. ④ If any damage occurs due to a violation of this Article by contestants, event participants, commercial rights holders, etc., they may be held liable for compensation and may be subject to disciplinary action or other disadvantageous measures in accordance with the relevant regulations.
